com.sri.ai.grinder.library.set

Class CountingFormulaEquivalentExpressions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.library.set.CountingFormulaEquivalentExpressions

  • @Beta
public class CountingFormulaEquivalentExpressions
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of utility routines around counting formula equivalent expressions. These are expressions which have the express goal of representing a number of satisfying solutions. Counting formula equivalent expressions are:
    1. Counting formulas: e.g.: 
           | X in 1..10 : X < 5 |
    2. Cardinality functor applications to intensional multisets, e.g.: 
           | {{ (on X in 1..10) tuple(X) : X < 5 }} |
     and
     | {{ (on X in 1..10) p(X) : X < 5 }} |
    3. Cardinality functor applications to intensional unisets whose head is a tuple over the indices, e.g.: 
           | { (on X in 1..10) tuple(X) : X < 5 } |
    Author:
    oreilly

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public static Expression getType()
        Returns:
        the type (i.e. Integer) of all counting formula equivalent expressions.

      • isCountingFormulaEquivalentExpression

        public static boolean isCountingFormulaEquivalentExpression(Expression expression)
        Tests if a given expression is equivalent to a counting formula. Three cases exist for this currently:
        1. Instances of the CountingFormula interface.
        2. Applications of the cardinality functor to intensional multisets.
        3. Applications of the cardinality functor to intensional unisets whose head is a tuple over the indices of the set.
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the given expression is equivalent semantically to a counting formula, false otherwise.
